com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features

Class FeatureAutoConfigurable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Feature
      • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Features.FeatureAutoConfigurable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FeatureCompass, FeatureMemsSensorFusion

    public abstract class FeatureAutoConfigurable
extends Feature
    Extend the feature adding the possibility to be configured sending a command message to the node.

    We can start an auto configuration process that will start an algorithm that will run on the remote device that will extract the information needed for the configuration.

    The user will be informed of the status of this process with a callback on the method notifyAutoConfigurationStatus(int) when the percentage of the process receive the 100% the configuration is finished.

    When the configuration finish the user will receive a callback to the method notifyConfigurationFinished(int) with the final configuration goodness or a negative value if there was an error during the configuration

    • Nested Class Summary

      static interface  FeatureAutoConfigurable.FeatureAutoConfigurationListener
      extend the Feature.FeatureListener with the callback used for notify the configuration status

        public FeatureAutoConfigurable(java.lang.String name,

    • Method Detail

      • notifyAutoConfigurationStart

        protected void notifyAutoConfigurationStart()
        call the method FeatureAutoConfigurable.FeatureAutoConfigurationListener.onAutoConfigurationStarting(FeatureAutoConfigurable) for each listener that subscribe to this feature.

        each call will be run in a different thread

      • notifyAutoConfigurationStatus

        protected void notifyAutoConfigurationStatus(int status)
        call the method FeatureAutoConfigurable.FeatureAutoConfigurationListener.onAutoConfigurationStatusChanged(FeatureAutoConfigurable, int) for each listener that subscribe to this feature.

        each call will be run in a different thread

        Parameters:
        status - status of the initialization process, 0 = not started 100=completed

      • notifyConfigurationFinished

        protected void notifyConfigurationFinished(int status)
        call the method FeatureAutoConfigurable.FeatureAutoConfigurationListener.onConfigurationFinished(FeatureAutoConfigurable, int) for each listener that subscribe to this feature.

        each call will be run in a different thread

        Parameters:
        status - last status of the calibration process, 0 = not started 100=completed

      • startConfiguration

        protected boolean startConfiguration(byte[] data)
        start a configuration process
        Parameters:
        data - raw data to use for initialize this feature
        Returns:
        true if the request is correctly send

        the data array can have length 0, in this case no data payload will be send to the feature characteristics

      • parseCommandResponse

        protected void parseCommandResponse(int timeStamp,
                                    byte commandType,
                                    byte[] data)
        this method will parse the response to a stopAutoConfiguration or configuration status commands. those commands contains a status, that is -1 if there is an error, or a percentage that represent the calibration goodness
        Overrides:
        parseCommandResponse in class Feature
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - device time stamp of when the response was send
        commandType - id of the request that the feature did
        data - data attached to the response

        it is implemented as an empty method, it is an optional abstract method

      • startAutoConfiguration

        public boolean startAutoConfiguration()
        start a initialization process, that doesn't require data
        Returns:
        true if the request is correctly send

      • stopAutoConfiguration

        public boolean stopAutoConfiguration()
        Stop the auto configuration procedure

        the node will notify to the user that the procedure stops with a call back on the method FeatureAutoConfigurable.FeatureAutoConfigurationListener.onConfigurationFinished(FeatureAutoConfigurable, int)

        Returns:
        true if the request is correctly send to the node

      • requestAutoConfigurationStatus

        public boolean requestAutoConfigurationStatus()
        Request to know the current status of the auto configuration procedure

        the status will be notify by a callback to notifyAutoConfigurationStatus(int)

        Returns:
        true if the request is correctly send to the node

      • setConfigurationStatus

        protected void setConfigurationStatus(boolean status)
        change the configuration status
        Parameters:
        status - new configuration status

      • isConfigured

        public boolean isConfigured()
        True if a feature is configured
        Returns:
        true if the feature is configured, false otherwise
